title: How to Make Crab Lumpia

steps.headline: Stir fry the crab meat in a non - stick Wok pan or frying pan on medium heat in small amount of vegetable oil (1/2 cup vegetable oil).
Add the spices, fruits and aromatics: onions, garlic, ginger, celery, thyme, apple and pineapple.
Stir fry the crabs with the spices until the flavors has infused.
Set the stir fried crabs to room temperature to cool down.
steps.description: This avoids the eggs from cooking.

steps.headline: Add  eggs to your stir fried crabs and mix.
Add salt and pepper to taste
Add 1 teaspoon of the stir fried crab mix into a lumpia wrapper and wrap.
steps.description: Or just add enough crab mixture for your lumpia wrapper.

steps.headline: Deep fry on high heat in vegetable oil for a few minutes (estimated 1 - 2 minutes) then gradually low cooking temperature.
Cook on low heat until medium cooked and lumpia wrapper is dark brown on the outside.
Remove excess oil by placing the crab lumpia in filter or strainer.
Serve with any of your favorite sauce or condiments.

text: Stir fry the crab meat in a non - stick Wok pan or frying pan on medium heat in small amount of vegetable oil (1/2 cup vegetable oil).  Add the spices, fruits and aromatics: onions, garlic, ginger, celery, thyme, apple and pineapple.  Stir fry the crabs with the spices until the flavors has infused.  Set the stir fried crabs to room temperature to cool down. This avoids the eggs from cooking. Add  eggs to your stir fried crabs and mix.  Add salt and pepper to taste  Add 1 teaspoon of the stir fried crab mix into a lumpia wrapper and wrap. Or just add enough crab mixture for your lumpia wrapper. Deep fry on high heat in vegetable oil for a few minutes (estimated 1 - 2 minutes) then gradually low cooking temperature.  Cook on low heat until medium cooked and lumpia wrapper is dark brown on the outside.  Remove excess oil by placing the crab lumpia in filter or strainer.  Serve with any of your favorite sauce or condiments. Eat and enjoy.
tyn_model: non - stick wok pan or frying pan
